intro: Saurauia scaberrima, commonly known as the roughleaf saurauia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a rough texture, giving it its common name. Saurauia scaberrima produces small, fragrant flowers that are often white or pale pink, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
